summary: The video discusses the claim that walking in the rain is better than running in terms of getting less wet. Jamie and Adam from the 'MythBusters' team set up an experiment to test this theory. They wear tight-fitting clothes and add dye to the water to make it easier to see how much they get wet. They conduct the experiment in both windy and non-windy conditions, measuring the weight of their clothes before and after walking and running through an artificial rainfall setup. The results show that running in the rain makes them wetter than walking, supporting the initial claim.
keywords: walking, running, rain, MythBusters, experiment, rainfall, wetness, weight, clothes, wind, artificial rainfall, dye, water absorption
